inventory.commentary: 23Apr08 added features. updated to wn2.1, added sense, modified definitions, examples ahouston

sense.name: things purchased which are considered to have lasting value
sense.commentary: INVESTMENT[+artifact][+purchased][+with_value][+lasting] Note: refers to the thing bought, not the activity of spending money Note: X's investment BE Y
sense.examples: A used car is rarely a good investment. A couple of beautiful well-made pieces are a sound investment for any woman's wardrobe. His obscure art collection has become a lucrative investment after all these years.

sense.name: the act of devoting time and energy to something
sense.examples: Providing our children with solid education is a meaningful investment in their future. Mary's investment of time and energy on behalf of the town's conservation areas is admirable. John quit the club because it became too much of investment of his leisure time. The city is planning a major investment in the repair and improvement of infrastructure.

sense.name: the activity of investing money for profit
sense.commentary: INVESTMENT[+event][+commitment][+of_money][+for_profit] [+quantity][+money][+committed] Note: X's investment of Y for Z -> X invested Y to buy Z
sense.examples: He has made a lot of money through his investments in overseas hedge funds. Investment in the high tech sector right now could be risky with the state of the economy. They lost a $50,000 investment in that real estate deal.
